version.change: All commands now use a different syntax. Instead of using double brackets `[[like this]]`, arguments must be in single brackets `[like this]`. For commands that take multiple arguments, each argument must be in its own set of brackets `[like][this]`. Each argument can be anywhere in your message, even if there are words in between them.

`!remind` and `!announce` now accept more different date formats. You can now use two-digit years and omit the date argument altogether, and timezones are now accepted as UTC offsets in hours (e.g. +8.5 or -6 instead of +0850 or -0600). Send `!help [!remind]` or `!help [!announce]` for details.
The command list from sending `!help` is now much easier to read.
Embeds from the `!magic` command are now colored according to their card's color identity.
You can now search for a Magic card from a specific set by adding a `|` and the set code like `!magic [Lightning Bolt|STA]`. Send `!help [!magic]` for more details.

The `!calc` command now better distinguishes negative numbers from subtraction, can read implicit multiplication (for example, `2(2)`), and can now calculate absolute value `abs()` and base 10 logarithms `log()`.
Fixed `!remind` and `!announce` to correctly accept time between 12:00 and 12:59 AM or PM.
Added the `!calc` command to calculate equations. To learn more, send `!help [[!calc]]`.
When sending an unknown command, you can now send `!yes` to automatically use the provided suggestion.
Separated `!remind` command into `!remind` and `!time`. `!remind` and `!announce` now only support date arguments, while `!time` only supports time arguments.
`!remind` and `!announce` commands are now more flexible with the formatting of arguments they accept.
Fixed a bug where `!roll` command wouldn't work with an argument of `2`.
Fixed a bug where reminders and announcements wouldn't trigger after FunkyBot resets.
Feedback added when a user enters an incorrect command.
`!magic` now provides price information in USD.
Made `!cute` and `!react` commands less likely to post images recently posted using them.
`!binary` and `!hex` commands can now convert up to three numbers.
`!roll` can now roll up to five dice. If more than one die roll is requested, your total roll will be displayed.
Polls now run for three hours instead of one.
Slightly changed the possible answers for the `!ask` command to make noncommittal answers less common.
Improved feedback for user when using the `!remind` or `!announce` commands
Replaced message sent with the `!hello` command with an embed containing more information
Added Discord status to FunkyBot to display '!help'
Changed links from `!magic` and `!wiki` commands to be in the embed rather than the message
